page.title: 18TRADE
page.content: TRADE IN APPLEDORE IS LIMITED, BUT THE VILLAGE STILL HAS A POST OFFICE- CUM- GENERAL STORES, A GREENGROCERS,AND A DAIRY WHICH SELLS PROVISIONS AND NEWSPAPERS,A BAKERY,A CRAFT SHOP WHICH ATTRACTS TOURISTS,AND A FORGE WHICH PROVIDES A REPAIR AND WELDING SERVICE. THERE ARE FOUR BUIDING CONTRACTORS, THREE HAIRDRESSERS,THREE PUBLIC HOUSES, A BOARDING KENNELS,A GARAGE AND A FARM VEHICLE REPAIR DEPOT. UNFORTUNATELY FOR THE LOCAL TRADERS, SHOPPING IN SUPERMARKETS IS CHEAPER AND THEREFORE VILLAGERS WITH CARS,OR WHO ARE ABLE TO COPE WITH CARRYING THEIR SHOPPING ON THE BUS, GENERALLY BUY THEIR MAIN PROVISIONS IN TENTERDEN WHICH IS FIVE MILES DISTANT, OR ASHFORD SOME EIGHT MILES AWAY.
